title: The 10th-gen iPad is a legit bargain at $100 off right now
content:
Macworld

Ever since it arrived, the 10th-gen iPad has been hard to recommend at its full $449 price, which is too high to be truly considered a budget bargain. However, a sale like this makes it easy to recommend: Amazon is selling the 10th-gen iPad in all four colors with 64GB of storage for $349, a savings of $100 and the best price we’ve ever seen.

The 10th-gen iPad hit shelves in 2022 as an inside-out overhaul of Apple’s entry-level tablet, with a 10.9-inch display and an A14 processor. It ditches the Home button and moves the Touch ID sensor to the power button like the iPad mini. It also has full support for the newest Apple Pencil with USB-C, which Amazon is selling for $69 ($10 off).

The 10th-gen iPad is an excellent tablet but Apple has better options if you’re spending full price. At this discount, however, it gets our full recommendation.
